headline: Joey's Peanut Butter Cookies
description: The best peanut butter cookies are made with this easy recipe that uses a double dose of peanut butter for fluffy cookies that melt in your mouth.

video.description: Simple and exquisite peanut butter cookies!
video.name: Joey's Peanut Butter Cookies

name: Joey's Peanut Butter Cookies

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).

Cream together peanut butter, butter, white sugar, and brown sugar in a large bowl until well blended. Beat in egg until well combined. Mix in milk and vanilla. Combine flour, baking powder, and salt in a separate bowl; stir into peanut butter mixture until incorporated.
Roll tablespoonfuls of dough into balls. Place cookies 2 inches apart onto ungreased cookie sheets. Press each ball once with fork tines.
Bake in the preheated oven until edges are lightly browned, 8 to 10 minutes.

review.reviewBody: I followed recipe to a tee. The cookies were soft and "pea nutty"tasting. I baked for just around 9-10 minutes at 350. Take out and let sit on the baking sheet another 2 minutes. Makes 2 dozen medium sized cookies.
They came out perfect!

I want chewy middle and crisp edges with a bold peanut butter flavor. These are not the ones for me. Kinda like a sweet flour puck. Not disgusting, but I won't eat 'em. Should be ok for kiddos, though.

This recipe is easy to follow and the cookies are delicious . I used parchment paper sheets when baking .I dunked my fork in granulated white sugar when putting the fork prints in the peanut butter balls on the cookie sheet . It keeps the fork from sticking to the cookie dough . Great cookie .Great recipe . Karen

These are easy to make and delicious. Has a tender texture that is a tad dry. But great flavor. I baked on parchment which is always my preference for baking cookies. Let sit a few minutes after coming out of oven (11 min) and moved to cooling rack. They still wanted to fall apart a little until fully cooled. But overall a good cookie.
These are very tasty but I felt the cookies needed a crunch factor. So I added chopped peanuts to the batter which elevated these cookies to next level.

It's always interesting to read recipe reviews and hear people's opinions on how to "make it better." Most are worthy of a listen but some are dumb beyond all measure. Dumb would be any change to these cookies. I own a chain of eight restaurants in the mid-Atlantic. I found this recipe about 10 years ago when we started. I have been serving this EXACT recipe to thousands of customers since. I have made enormous sums of money from customers coming in for these amazing cookies and becoming lifelong customers. THIS is the ultimate peanut butter cookie. The balance of ingredients and preparation is something i could spend hours writing about. Do not change one thing. It is sheer perfection. PERIOD.

Best peanut butter cookie recipe. These cookies get inhaled. Love the deli owner with the "top critical review" who created an account just to announce that their own recipe is perfect. Sure, Jan. That's why you're online looking for new recipes.
The perfect best of all.

Perfect texture! Slightly crispy outside, soft inside. Had no problem rolling them despite the dough being very fluffy. A little bit on the bland side, but still pretty good. Next time I make these, I will add a bag of peanut butter chips, 1 tsp cinnamon, and maybe 1/2 tsp nutmeg.

It was delish! Would have gotten 5 stars if the peanut butter flavor hadn't "disappeared" a little bit. I tried a little bit of the dough before baking and it was perfect (not recommending to eat lots of it raw, because it has egg and flour) it also crumbled a bit and cracked when I used the fork, but I think that's normal.
Nice job. Really good.
The very best recipes. This has been my go to for years. A family favorite for sure.

For those bakers who complained about this recipe; it has baking powder in it which affects the texture of the final bake. You may be used a peanut butter cookie recipe with baking soda which yields a denser, more chewy cookie
These are the ONLY peanut butter cookies I make now…. Over a dozen times.
Hands down. Best peanut butter cookie recipe I’ve tried. They are not dry or hard. They are awesome in every way.
I didn't change a thing. These are the best peanut butter cookies I have ever tasted. Soft ,moist and chewy, just the way I like them.
Yooo why this come out crumbly and weird. Taste ok lol but I’m not picky they just won’t stay together.
It's the best peanut butter cookies I've EVER made, even better than my mom's! 10/10 will make again.
Absolutely delicious, chewy and just enough peanut butter flavor. Thought the baking time should be increased to 12-14 minutes (just my preference)

This by far my favorite cookie recipe. My family love these cookies I get a lot of requests to bake them. I would pay close attention to how long you bake them. The minimum time is best for me any longer they get real hard,.

Original Peanut Butter Cookies around early to mid 1950’s recipe used Can Crisco or other brand lard even Wesson Oil and Peter Pan Peanut Butter or Skippy. Cookies were not made to be soft but crisp and if I’m going to want Peanut Butter Cookies these are what I want. May not be healthy but sure are delicious.
These cookies are delicious!!! Could've used more peanut butter.
This recipe is top notch
We love them,the best yet to me
I think the effect of using butter just decreased the flavor of the peanut butter. Ended up with a tasteless cookie. Bleh. Previous reviews definitely over-rated this recipe in my opinion.

Made this without white sugar, substituted for a full cup of brown sugar. Used just about 2 cups of PB and no vanilla extract. Didn't matter, turned out freaking delicious! Let bake for 20 minutes in an electric oven.

These cookies were splendid. I eliminated the milk and they came out perfect. The right amount of peanut butter flavor, soft fluffy texture. One of the best peanut butter cookie recipes I've ever tried.
FAIL - JUST WRONG. Can’t believe all the positive ratings…. SMH.

I was craving peanut butter cookies so i tried these and they did not disappoint! I will keep this recipe as my base recipe. Today i left half the batter plain and half the batter i added dark chocolate morsels. So good!

These were not my favorite peanut butter cookie recipe. I usually go with the classic recipe but figured I would try something new. I think having less butter in this recipe makes them a bit more ‘dry’ . I always undertake my cookies so they are slightly chewy but these just seem very dry to me.

I lost my binder of beloved recipes in my recent move, but I somehow remembered that my favorite peanut butter cookie recipe was called "Joey's Peanut Butter Cookies" !! This is definitely the right recipe. Cookies always come out perfect. They're gone so quickly. These are the best. I've been using this recipe for ten years or so now :) Thank you thank you !!!

I think they are delicious however I did add chocolate chips to mine and I definitely believe that made them better. I will bake again but next time I will add a little more sugar to make a bit sweeter, then I believe that will receive a 5 star rating! Thanks Joey, great cookies! 
I do NOT understand the below 4 star ratings at all because I'm pretty picky about my cookies! LoL
Easy recipe great cookies everyone loved them
Well these were sure yummy. I added butterscotch chips to half the batch, and caramel chips to 1/4 batch and plain other 1/4. Toss up - 3 awesome cookies in one!
followed recipe as written, turned out great.

My wife passed this recipe over to me, via one of her fellow workers, telling me, the recipe had to be tried. I was a miserable day, so I made them, according to the recipe, not adding my usual dried cranberries or sliced almonds, but with a half cup of chocolate chips. I like to give my Chocolate chip cookies a bit of glamour. I made them, almost word for word, and must report, I will sack all my other cookie recipes, as these are the ultimate, and so easy to make. Say thanks to Joey if you see him, R

These cookies are literally the BEST peanut butter cookies EVER! The ONLY "complaint" I have is that as I was taking them out of the oven and putting them aside to cool, well, they did not last very long and I kept eating them. Then, I tried them with a glass of ice cold milk and was in literal Heaven! I will make these again and again!
I’ve made these cookies several times. I follow the recipe exactly... It’s perfect.

I used crunchy peanut butter. I also only had half n half, so I used 1.5 Tbs H&H mixed with 1.5Tbs water. I also added 3/4 C chocolate chips, without changing the recipe. I would add 1 tsp of salt -- just shy salt, and peanut butter cookies need a kick of salty with the sweet. Texture light and fluffy. TIP: Do not over cream or over stir. Cookies will be flat and runny.
Everyone loves these cookies! They are excellent.

So I went through the reviews before I decided to use this recipe and some of the bad reviews almost made me not use it but I decided to anyway and I’m glad I did! As long as you follow the directions and know what you’re doing this recipe should turn out awesome. If it turns out “bland” or “not peanut buttery enough” then you did something wrong because these Scream PEANUT BUTTER.
Not a fan of this recipe. I searched for a soft chewy peanut butter cookie but this one is dry not chewy. It also doesn't have much flavor. Rather bland not peanut butter cookies like my mom baked.

I really like this cookie recipe . 
I have made these cookies several times & I’m always very pleased with the flavour and texture . 
Overall it’s a very good cookie recipe,
you won’t be disappointed. 
I like to use chunky PB

It is a decent soft cookie recipe. Did not have robust peanut butter flavor so it's great for a cookie cookie. Added in baking soda second time, took out vanilla flavor & added in mini chocolate chips for just a cookie jar at hand snack.

Tastes like less crunchy PB biscotti. I followed recipe to the letter, and they are airy and crunchy not soft and chewy the way a peanut butter cookie should be. Kinda sad I wasted all my ingredients because now I have to wait to make proper batch.
These were so good. Light and peanut buttery. I crushed part for a crust for a peanut butter pie. Yummy!

I thought this was very good cookies and I absolutely loved them! It was very good adding choclate chips. I would recommend that. If you do not pack the brown sugar in the batter will become sticky and hard to roll. So pack the brown sugar! These are the best peanut butter cookies if made correct.

I put about a 1/4 cup more flour in because I find the mixture a bit too sticky to roll into a ball otherwise. Other than that, this recipe is fantastic! I love peanut butter cookies (my Mom bake them all the time) and 50+ years later, I'm still enjoying them just as much. Good memories!
Recipe didn’t turn out.. followed step by step...

These cookies are absolutely DELICIOUS and not dry! I baked mine @350 for 12 minutes.

The dough is a little loose. I only ever bake one tray of cookies at a time, and refrigerated the remainder. The next day, the consistency was perfect and could easily be rolled into balls (also then rolled in sugar).

I'd recommend refrigerating the dough for at least a few hours PRIOR to baking.
These were wonderful, very light compared to other denser cookies. The trick is to take them out of the oven just as some of the edges are turning light brown. Will definitely make again!
This recipe is perfect!

There were a couple missing details. This recipe was a little bit of a rollercoaster cause if you watched the video or skipped out on the reviews, your batter will make you question if you did something wrong. I'm just here to tell you to push through it and share some of the hiccups I ran into. I think the reason some people didn't like this recipe is because we're used to a certain texture when we're done mixing our batter. Mine came out mushy, yet still moldable enough to give me the impression I could have those perfect circles... I had to give up on that idea. There were no fork marks on my cookies. Then when you bake them, everyone's gonna have something different, so keep a close eye on them. (Mine baked at 375 for 16 mins) They looked burned when I took them out yet they felt like marshmallows when I slide them over to the drying racks. They looked clumpy but they tasted great. People weren't dying to know my recipe but I never had any left overs when I left them around my friends or family. Lastly, I used crunchy peanut butter.. just as a preference and they were fine. So, I hoped this helped someone out there.
It didn't even turn out like cookies.
not enough flour ended up soupy

This recipe was great. I used natural sugar free peanut butter as that’s all I keep in my house and was very happy with the result. I let them bake for a few minutes to soften in the oven before pressing them down with the fork due to the crumbly effect that was happening. They turned out soft in the middle and nice and golden after 8 mins in my convection oven. Will definitely make again!

These are good but not quite what I was expecting. Unfortunately I have to agree with some of the people who wrote not so great reviews in that they are a bit crumbly although once they cooled they stayed in one piece which was good. As far as flavor, I’m thinking they maybe could’ve used a little more salt and I’m a person who is not a big salt eater. Also, I rolled into the size balls they said to in recipe and I got 50 cookies! I may continue to keep looking for a better peanut butter cookie recipe.
There must be an error in the flour amount, or the fats. These cookies were greasy balls of dough and when baked spread into thin,tough, cookies... definitely not soft and chewy.
so so so so good!!
So far the best peanut butter cookies , my husband loves them.
These are very good! I was worried when the "dough" was super goopy and you can't roll it into balls but they turned out amazing!
I used baking soda instead of baking powder and they were perfect. The peanut butter flavor was just right. The cookies melted in my mouth.

Well I’d say these pass the test of being both delicious and beautiful. Yes, rolling them into a ball can be a little hard, and they stick to the fork when you press the criss-cross on them. Solution? Dip the fork in flour before pressing each cookie, and for rolling the halls, spray your hands with Pam.
This recipe was GREAT!!! I just added chocolate chips to it and it was awesome. They were crunchy on the outside and soft in the inside just like Peanut butter cookies are supposed be
I'm not even a peanut butter cookie fan but these are great. Very rich and buttery tasting. I used a little less sugar and still turned out fantastic.
I love this recipe. The cookies were soft, not too crunchy.--just how I like them.
These cookies are easy to put together and taste heavenly I added mini chocolate chips such a treat.

I loved this recipe! It is definitely a keeper. Even my brother liked it, and he is really, really, really, REALLY hard to please. I forgot that you can’t make them with natural peanut butter, so I used Adam’s. They turned out fine in the end, though. They even had a nicer, buttery, softer texture! They were gone in about 30 minutes flat. And I did 3 batches!

This is my 3rd time making these, I love the recipe. I add 6oz of mini chocolate chips to them and cook them a few minutes longer to get the edges a little crispy. They never seemed done at 10 mins, could be my oven
Meh. I can't put my finger on what was off about the recipe, but my daughter didn't like them either.
Great recipe! I added about half a cup of oats for texture, plus a bit more milk to keep the dough soft. Next time I might add peanuts for more texture

I realized i didn't have peanut butter after I had already mixed the sugar, brown sugar, and butter so I used nutella instead and it came out okay. I had to put it in the oven for longer and they came out very flat and crunchy but it was sort of a brownie brittle texture which was very delicious, especially with a nice glass of milk :)
I went with chunky pb which is good I just kinda cooked it too long, bottom shelf is shorter time
During Covid19 lockdown we made this recipe. Fortunately made a double batch. Can't wait to marry some up to a glass of milk. Rolled the cookie in granulated sugar prior to fork treatment. Yummy
Oh my gosh. Add peanut and/chocolate chips, and it’s the bomb. I mean the best you’ve ever had!
Excellent best peanut butter cookies ever.

This is without a doubt, a below average recipe. Ok, but would never make them again. Bland is the best word for them. I used to have an awesome peanut cookie recipe and I couldn't find it so I tried this one. I used Jiff Natural.
So good!! and I even made it gluten free. very delicious!!

I used wheat pastry flour. Other than that, everything works: milk is a nice add. If you make your cookie batter balls too large, then you must cook them longer: the batter spreads as it cooks, but the criss-cross imprint holds well. Do let them cool before transferring to the rack. They batter was very light: like mousse, so keep the balls small and tight. I'd make these again!
A softer cookie. Very flavorful!
Made these after Christmas for hubby. It’s his favorite. Of course they have to have a Chocolate KISS candy on top.
These cookies were ok. Not bad but not spectacular. My husband had me add chocolate chips to some to make them more appealing.
So easy to make, and delicious! I did not roll them into a ball first, I just spooned them out and pressed each with a fork; they look more homemade that way and get crispier around the edges. Yum!
First time I've made a recipe and didn't make additions or substitutions! My family loved them, this is a keeper!

I LOVE this recipe!! I have been making these for years and years. They are my go to recipe for peanut butter cookies, and are the best I've ever had. I use this recipe every year for my Christmas peanut butter blossoms. The only thing I do different is add a little extra peanut butter, just to make them even MORE peanut buttery! I don't understand anyone who says this recipe isn't good!
Excellent and super easy too! Don’t change a thing!
Joey did good! Followed the recipe and was not disappointed. Peanutbutter cookies have never been easy for me for some reason. This recipe made me look good - thanks Joey!
great recipe!

First attempt at making peanut butter cookies and they turned out pretty well. Tasty and definitely a lot of peanut butter flavor. I'll probably try to make them again, but feel like we could do without as much flour.
I have made this same recipe for years. These are my go to peanut butter cookies and my family loves them.
First batch was hard and crumbled. I made my second batch with two eggs instead of one. Way better. Cookies came out most and chewy
These are good but needs more peanut butter flavor. I like the fluffy, thickness of them.

These are just okay. You can barely taste the peanut butter which is surprising since this recipe uses twice as much as most other recipes. I see other reviewers have described the texture as chalky or pasty. I would agree. The cookies didn’t really spread or raise when baked. This recipe also uses less sugar than most so if you like a not-so-sweet cookie, you might like it. After baking the first pan, I decided to roll the remaining cookies in sugar before baking. We liked those much better, but not enough to make again.
Delicious soft really good
Made them for my brother because that’s he’s favorite cookie, he loved them they were delicious.
Super! Added 3/4 cups peanuts.
Best peanut butter cookies I have ever made. They stay soft and we love them
Good cookies. My dough was a little on the soft side. I think I will add a little more flour next time.
